
{{alias}}( x )
    Evaluates the inverse error function.

    The domain of `x` is restricted to `[-1,1]`. If `|x| > 1`, the function
    returns `NaN`.

    If provided `NaN`, the function returns `NaN`.

    The inverse error function is an odd function: `erfinv(-x) = -erfinv(x)`.
    Thus, in accordance with the IEEE 754 standard, if provided `-0`, the
    function returns `-0`.

    Parameters
    ----------
    x: double
        Input value.

    Returns
    -------
    y: double
        Function value.

    Examples
    --------
    > var y = {{alias}}( 0.5 )
    ~0.4769
    > y = {{alias}}( 0.8 )
    ~0.9062
    > y = {{alias}}( 0.0 )
    0.0
    > y = {{alias}}( -0.0 )
    -0.0
    > y = {{alias}}( -1.0 )
    -infinity
    > y = {{alias}}( 1.0 )
    infinity
    > y = {{alias}}( NaN )
    NaN

    See Also
    --------
